variant.bodyText: Books listed below that are marked with a t will be reviewed in a future issue. Authors and publishers who wish their books to be considered for review in Com- putational Linguistics should send a copy to the book review editor, Graeme Hirst, De- partment of Computer Science, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada M5S 1A4. All books received will be listed, but not all can be re- viewed. Readers who wish to review books for the journal should write, outlining their qualifi- cations, to the book review editor at the ad- dress above. Obviously, we cannot promise the availability of books in anyone's exact area of interest. Linguistics: An Introduction to Language and Communication (Third Edition) Adrian Akmajian, Richard A. Demers, Ann K. Farmer, and Robert M. Hamish (University of Arizona and State University of New York at Albany) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1990, xiv + 508 pp. Paperbound, ISBN 0-262-51042-1, $24.95; Hardbound, ISBN 0-262-01109-3, $45.00

James Allen, James Hendler, and Austin Tate, editors (University of Rochester, University of Maryland, and University of Edinburgh) San Mateo, CA: Morgan Kaufmann, 1990, xiii + 754 pp. (Morgan Kaufmann Series in Representation and Reasoning) Paperbound, ISBN 1-55860-130-9, $38.95

William J. Clancey and Elliot Soloway (Institute for Research on Learning and University of Michigan) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1990, 162 pp. (A reprint of Artificial Intelligence, 42(1), 1990, special issue) Paperbound, ISBN 0-262-53090-2, $19.95 tCurrent Research in Natural Language Generation Robert Dale, Chris Mellish, and Michael Zock, editors (University of Edinburgh and CNRS) London: Academic Press, 1990, ix + 356 pp. (Cognitive Science Series) Hardbound, ISBN 0-12-200735-2, $45.00, £23.50 Representations of Commonsense Knowledge Ernest Davis (New York University) San Mateo, CA: Morgan Kaufmann, 1990, xxiii + 515 pp. (Morgan Kaufmann Series in Representation and Reasoning) Hardbound, ISBN 1-55860-033-7, $42.95

Gonzalez Redwood City, CA: Benjamin/Cummings, 1991, 230 pp. Paperbound, ISBN 0-8053-2529-8, $13.95 As Time Goes By: Tense and Universal Grammar Norbert Hornstein (University of Maryland) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1990, xii + 242 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-262-08191-1, $25.00 Machine Learning, Volume III
variant.bodyText: Yves Kodratoff and Ryszard Michalski, editors (CNRS and George Mason University) San Mateo, CA: Morgan Kaufmann, 1990, x + 825 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 1-55860-119-8, $49.95 The Age of Intelligent Machines Raymond Kurzweil Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1990, xiii + 565 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-262-11121, $39.95
Paul Luff, Nigel Gilbert, and David Frohlich, editors (University of Surrey) London: Academic Press, 1990, 284 pp. (Computers and People Series) Hardbound, ISBN 0-12-459560-X, $45.00, £23.95

Stephen Neale (Princeton University) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1990, xiv + 286 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-262-14045, $29.95 tSemantic Processing for Finite Domains Martha Stone Palmer (National University of Singapore) Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 1990, ix + 199 pp. Computational Linguistics Volume 17, Number 1 (Studies in Natural Language Processing) Hardbound, ISBN 0-521-36226-1, $49.50

Computational Model of First Language Acquisition Nobuo Satake (University of Tokyo) Singapore: World Scientific, 1990, viii + 197 pp. (World Scientific Series in Computer Science 20) Hardbound, ISBN 981-02-0139-7, $28.00 Artificial Intelligence: An Engineering Approach Robert J. Schalkoff (Clemson University) New York: McGraw-Hill, 1990, xxiv + 646 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-07-055084-0 Readings in Uncertain Reasoning Glenn Shafer and Judea Pearl, editors (University of Kansas and University of California, Los Angeles) San Mateo, CA: Morgan Kaufmann, 1990, x + 768 pp. (Morgan Kaufmann Series in Representation and Reasoning) Paperbound, ISBN 1-55860-125-2, $38.95
